p: Another study on the same fungal strain 222 resulted in the discovery of six novel naphthalenone derivatives, balticols A−F ( 59– 64, Fig. 12 ) [ 61]. The balticols were tested at non-cytotoxic concentrations for their antiviral activity against Herpes simplex virus (HSV) type I. These compounds were found to showed inhibitory effect with IC 50 values of 1, 1, 1, 0.1, 0.01, 0.1 μg/mL, respectively [ 61]. Balticol E had the most remarkable result with IC 50 value of 0.01 μg/mL against HSV-1 [ 61].
